item.title: Help with my wcing script
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

There doesnt need to be a procedure for a start…
There just needs to be a tree chopper procedure
And a drop Procedure(Download SRL and put Dropall; :only for a power chopper!)
And one more thing…

Dont do a start thing…Thats one of the worsts power choppers you can make -.-
Do the procedures and for the end put…

[scar]
begin
ActivatClient;
SetUpSRL;
repeat
treechopper //(your tree chopper procedure name here
logdropper //(your logdropper procedure name here
until(false)
end.
[/scar]

thats it!

P.S. if you want to make it easier:download SRL then put a DropAll; procedure in your script!
Then put…
{include srl/srl.scar} like before
{include srl/srl/skill/WoodCutting.scar}

If it doesnt work then ask someone else for help theres more people to ask!

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my wcing script
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

well am no expert but i would say to put the if and the then thing on it
[scar]
program powercutter;
{.include SRL\SRL.scar}
const treecolor=3034709;
const logcolor= 666;

Procedure Start;
begin
activateclient;
dropto(2, 28);
if(findcolorspiral(x,y,treecolor,3,3,515,336))then
mmouse(x,y,3,3)
istextat2(9,9,‘hop’,20)
mouse(x,y,2,2,true)
dropto(2, 2)
repeat
until (false)
end;
begin
setupSRL;
repeat
until (false)
end.
[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Help with my wcing script
item.dc:creator: @killer_kure killer kure
item.description:
@killer_kure wrote:

i can’t get it to move or nothing
[scar]program powercutter;
{.include SRL\SRL.scar}
const treecolor=3034709;
const logcolor= 666;

Procedure Start;
begin
activateclient;
dropto(2, 28);
findcolorspiral(x,y,treecolor,3,3,515,336)
mmouse(x,y,3,3)
istextat2(9,9,‘hop’,20)
mouse(x,y,2,2,true)
dropto(2, 2)
repeat
until (false)
end;
begin
setupSRL;
repeat
until (false)
end.[/scar]
